message:
عادت ظاهرة السؤال بكثرة هذة الأيام ... ليست المشكلة في مستوى الأسئلة فنحن نرحب بالمساعدة للكل المبتدئين قبل المحترفين ... المشكلة ان البعض اعتاد الاستسهال ... فبدلاً من أن يذهب الفرد الى Google ويبحث عن حل للمشكلة التي تواجهه ويقرأ ويجرب يأتي الى هنا ويسأل السؤال بدون حتى أن يتعب نفسه في توفير المعلومات الكافية حول المشكلة ... إسمحوا لي أن أسرد قصة حدثت لي متذ سنتان تقريباً ...
كنت أبحث في أمر  دقيق جداً لإعدادات خادم Apache ليعمل على Windows ... قرأت في الـ Documentation الخاصة بـ Apache وموقع آخر خاص بـ Apache لـ Windows يدعى (ِApache Lounge) وبحثت في StackOverflow لم أجد اجابة فقمت بطرح السؤال على Stackoverflow وجائت أربعة اجابات لم تكن تحديداً ما أبحث عنه ...
أثناء البحث لفت انتباهي اجابات تنم عن معرفة قوية جداً لمصري على Stackoverflow ... طالعت اجاباته فوجدت انه متخصص في اعدادات الخودام فبحثت عنه ووجدته على Github و Twitter ووصلت إلى بريده الإليكتروني الشخصي. أرسلت إليه رسالة تعريفية أعرفه بنفسي وأطلب منه المساعدة ... شرحت له في الرسالة كافة الروابط التي عثرت عليها والحلول التي جربتها ولم تساعدني في حل مشكلتي والسؤال الذي سألته على Stackoverflow و Serverfault. ذيلت الرسالة بأنها ليست عادتي أن أسأل أحد على بريده الشخصي وانني متفهم تماماً اذا اختار عدم الرد واننا احترم ذلك ... جائني الرد بعد نصف ساعة وسأقتبس كلماته:
" I usually don't give private consultation for free, but I would probably hate myself if I didn't offer help after you have put some obvious effort in research and in understanding and writing about your problem"
وقام هذا الشخص العزيز بالرد على استفساري وساعدني في حل المشكلة. أصبحنا بعدها أصدقاء وتطورت العلاقة بيننا وعملنا سوياً.
ما أريد ان أقوله للزملاء الجدد أنه طالما لم تقم بشرح المشكلة التي تواجهها بشكل كامل وأظهرت المجهود الذي بذلته لمحاولة الوصول الى حل لن يهتم أحد لمساعدتك لأنه ببساطة "احنا فينا اللي مكفينا" ... من أجل أن نصل الى نقاشات مثمرة يجب أن تظهر المجهود الذي تبذله.

data.message: مهو المشكلة ان انتوا "الادمنز" الى مأخدينا عليكوا وبتجاوبوا :d
طلع الغلط فينا :) صدقني كلنا ادينا بتاكلنا على الرد في كل المواضيع :D
اللي يسأل سؤال من النوعية دي خد كلامه و حطه في lmgtfy.com و رد عليه باللينك :D

المشكلة ان المكان ده المفروض لنقاشات بنّاءة ... ممكن يترد بـ RTFM وانت جربت ايه وبروابط وبألف رد تاني ... المشكلة انك كده بتحول المكان ده لأنه يصبح زي أي جروب على Facebook فيه 19 ألف واحد ومفيش فيه أي حاجة مفيدة
انا عندى قناعة اننا كلنا ادمنز, لو تجاهلنا الاسئلة التى من هذه النوعية - رغم اننى اسئل مثلها احياناً- ستختفى, انا من ناحيتى مش هرد
المشكلة إنهم بيزيدوا يا عمرو، يعني ممكن نتجاهل الرد، بس بقت نسبة الأسئلة دي للـposts بتزيد بشكل مش طبيعي!

الفكرة ان الناس بتسأل الاسئلة وبيلاقى غضاضة فى انك تقترح عليك Google It من ايام قليلة بس كنت ادمن فى جروب Egy C# Developers وخرجت منه العدد الى عليه حوالى 15 الف معظم الناس اسئلتها بل تقريبا كل الناس اسئلتها من النوعية المفروض انها لو اتعمل لها post هنا تتحذف وش لكن من معاملتى على مدار سنه مع الناس دى هما مش بيملوا ابدا من انهم يحطوا بوستات وتتحذف وبعدين يكتب بوست انتوا حذفتوا البوست ليه وهيقصر عليك ويقولك دورت فى جوجل مش عارف ولو جبت له جوجل هيقولك مش فاهم اشرحلى بالعربى للأسف معظم الناس الى بتسأل بيكون هو محطوط فى case وعايز يخرج منها بحل Code عشان يخرج بيه من المشكلة لكن للأسف معظمهم او اغلبهم كأساس مفيش يعنى احد الأعضاء كان بيسأل ازاى يعرف variable من نوع string بس اسم ال variable عايز يحط فيه dot وطبعا الناس بدأت تقترح عليه بدل وتجود وتخترع الفكرة مش فى الناس دى لوحدها بيكون فيه حد دون المستوى خالص وحد تانى منتظر سؤاله بيكون دون المستوى بس اعلى شوية فبيكون فرصه ليه انه يحل له سؤاله ويظهر وكدا :) فالموضوع دا عشان يتحل ان الجروب يكون معلن تماما انه مش للمبتدئين
Mohammed Ragab this highlights a need for learning that people have, it should be emraced. I am joining that group
the thing is, even the so called "elites" can ahve trouble with basic concepts and even forget them. No  one is too good for the basics

Mohamed Samy هى الفكرة ان الناس نفسها محتاجة تساعدك انك تساعدهم يعنى مثلا الناس محتاجة تثق ان مستواها هيكون احسن لو اقتنع ان فيه كونسبت لازم يتعلمها او يذاكرها لكن هو للأسف على اقتناع داخلى انه مش محتاج الكلام دا وانه مثلا بياخد كورس او بيتفرج على حد فى يوتيوب مش عايز هو يخرج من الجو دا اصلا فهو مقتنع تماما ان سؤاله عن حاجة شديدة البداهة انها من الأساسيات الى لابد يكون اتعلمها هو مش فاهم كدا مش قادر يفرق ان فيه حد ادنى عشان ابدأ اشتغل وللأسف مش عايز ومش قابل

sometimes and mainly, people need a human to answer. Sometimes for one of those people, your answer could be the magic. It's so funny when someone who write javascript for a living, spending his life organizng markup and to a real geek that could be a bad choice, but we can't control what people chose, but they can and will change :)
Mohamed Samy I don't get your point
sometimes as I am learning something new, I need a humanbeing to encourage me, to show me the way, to explain the commas and semi colons. Google can't do that
If you are learning something new and need help, that is what StackOverflow is for, or Egy C# Developers. Do we need to convert every single group to a SO clone?
Geeks = learning. Thinking I am an elite = Snobbery :)
Regardless of word play, the rules and the purpose of the group are very clear, and they are the reason why many people joined in the first place.

well, I think people don't realize that even declaring a constructor can be an advanced topic, and even the most basic syntax deserves a coser look. Actually, if people really love to code, declaring something as advanced or intermediate becomes pathetic, because every line of code is done with love ::)

Ahmed Al-Amir actually I have my own group dedicated to that concept, or rather a page. "Sufi Geeks". Other than that, I haven't found anything I would consider too  basic, and I see the admins are wanting to increase the numbers in the group for some reason :)
Samy, please forward these questions to your group / page. We wouldn't mind at all.

I have deleted many posts before for rule violations. However, when I see a post that violates the rules but has high engagement from other members, it feels wrong to delete it, as those members have basically gave it approval by contributing. It feels like lacking respect to all the members who commented to delete the post.
So, if no one responds, it's easier for me (and other admins) to delete it. Also reporting posts helps make it happen faster.

Mohamed Meligy I did get some questions there and answering them too. I just took a look at Egy C# and I see a very high collaboration there actually. What I would love is to contribute to that group in a way to help as many Geeks as possible of all levels

I mentioned at the beginning of the post that it's not about the level of the question. Let's talk for instance about one of the active questions here "which php framework do you recommend" what if we changed the question to be more specific like "I am new to php and I don't have any other background about programming, which php framework that would be easy for me to pick?" or "I searched for php frameworks and found a comparison about laravel and codeigniter but I am not sure which one should I pick, what do you recommend?" Isn't that better? I understand a little about Php but I would give my little personal experience about how awesome I found to work with laravel templating and views. This is how you build a discussion and help people,

Mohamed Samy: You are completely missing the point, the original problem discussed here is that many people don't exert any effort in trying to figure out the answer themselves first, which is an indication that they don't really want to learn and just want to get the thing done with minimal effort! (which is a bad trait in general)
This is the main problem that not many people here disagree on, and I hope you don't disagree on that.

Now the second problem which is much more controversial is whether to allow beginner questions in general (with visible effort from the asker or without), when people say they want to avoid beginner questions they aren't being elitists or egotistic (you always make it sound horrible like that :S), they just wish they could categorise things, basically have a group for beginner topics and a group for intermediate/advanced topics.
I'm personally part of this Egy C# group and I used to help a lot of people when I had more free time because I'm a normal person who likes helping beginners and I'm good at explaining things, then again I would like to have some sort of channel/stream of more advanced stuff that I could check, that's why I'm a member of this group and spend most of my time lurking around and learning from people who know more than me in certain areas.

Hassan Aly Selim I do believe it sounds horrible because it is. There are many groups out there on the internet and none of them have this strange categorization. One cold argue that as a PHD student of Mathematics, people here are not really advance, but that would just be plain wrong.  I believe people do need to search, but perhaps some need an extra hand to get started, not everone's brain is the same. Also, maybe what seems trivial to you might be advanced to others, and maybe what you see as advanced is trivial to some people.  In the end, someone who makes his living manipulating HTML markup with a scripting language might not sound like a geek at all to some Computer Scientist who goes to MIT, or Stanford. We can say level 100/200 topics go to a speciifc place, but we can't say that if someone here comes asking for help we act like a bunch of snobs. I remeber some people here when they started out, they were worthy of a lot of pity actually, but I helped them and possibly even provided opportunities for them. The idea is, even a trivial question by someone you deem a noob is your duty to answer if you can. Allah provides us with knowledge, so if you see yourself (directed to all) as a guru, then take on apprentices, do sessions and teach these people, help others learn. But just saying, I only want to see advance topics because I have outgrown this level 100 stuff, I just think it is immoral. I am sorry if this somehow comes accross angry, I am not angry or aggresive at all now, I am drinking coffee and explaining my concept :) There is a hadeeth that if you hide knowledge from someone, you get tied by a fire like a donkey. Anyway, this is the idea. Give and take, make rules, answer noob questions, make an faq, but don't delete or condescend them.
